intro: Eriocaulon abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
